result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mykale A Christian

defendant.name: Christian, Mykale A

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mykale A Christian appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed an Attorney. SPD has not appointed.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Branch PE.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court requested confirmation that defendant has made contact with SPD and been determined SPD eligible. 
Email sent to SPD on 9/22/22. SPD confirmed that the defendant completed the evaluation process and was found to be eligible for services on 8/12/2022.

Defendant Mykale A Christian appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mykale A Christian in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for status. Mr Christian needed to be evaluated by SPD to determine his eligibility. He has called their office prior to the case being called and the record and has been told he qualifies. Court ordered case adjourned for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Mykale A Christian in court in person.  Thomas L. Potter appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Mr Christian needs to contact  SPD to determine his eligibility. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated July 6, 2022 - received
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Mykale A Christian in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Mykale A Christian in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mykale A Christian appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
